fields.name: app
fields.description: Lookup an App by ID or return the currently authenticated App.

args.name: id
args.description: The ID to lookup the App by.

fields.name: appByHandle
fields.description:
Fetches app by handle.
Returns null if the app doesn't exist.

args.name: handle
args.description: Handle of the App.

fields.name: appByKey
fields.description:
Fetches an app by its client ID.
Returns null if the app doesn't exist.

args.name: apiKey
args.description: Client ID of the app.

fields.name: appDiscountType
fields.description: An app discount type.

args.name: functionId
args.description: The ID for the function providing the app discount type.

fields.name: appDiscountTypes
fields.description: A list of app discount types installed by apps.

fields.name: appInstallation
fields.description: Lookup an AppInstallation by ID or return the AppInstallation for the currently authenticated App.

args.name: id
args.description: ID used to lookup AppInstallation.

fields.name: appInstallations
fields.description: List of app installations. Requires the `read_apps` access scope.

args.name: first
args.description: Returns up to the first `n` elements from the list.

args.name: after
args.description: Returns the elements that come after the specified cursor.

args.name: last
args.description: Returns up to the last `n` elements from the list.

args.name: before
args.description: Returns the elements that come before the specified cursor.

args.name: reverse
args.description: Reverse the order of the underlying list.

args.name: sortKey
args.description: Sort the underlying list by the given key.

args.name: category
args.description: The category of app installations to fetch.

args.name: privacy
args.description: The privacy level of app installations to fetch.

fields.name: customerSegmentMembers
fields.description: The list of members, such as customers, that's associated with an individual segment.

args.name: segmentId
args.description: The ID of the segment.

args.name: query
args.description: The query that's used to filter the members. The query is composed of a combination of conditions on facts about customers such as `email_subscription_status = 'SUBSCRIBED'` with [this syntax](https://shopify.dev/api/shopifyql/segment-query-language-reference).

args.name: timezone
args.description: The timezone that's used to interpret relative date arguments. The timezone defaults to UTC if the timezone isn't provided.

args.name: reverse
args.description: Reverse the order of the list. The sorting behaviour defaults to ascending order.

args.name: sortKey
args.description: Sort the list by a given key.

args.description: Returns up to the first `n` elements from the list.

args.description: Returns the elements that come after the specified cursor.

args.name: last

args.name: before
args.description: Returns the elements that come before the specified cursor.

fields.name: customerSegmentMembership
fields.description: Whether a member, which is a customer, belongs to a segment.

args.name: segmentIds
args.description: The segments to evaluate for the given customer.

args.name: customerId
args.description: The ID of the customer that has the membership.

fields.name: product
fields.description: Returns a Product resource by ID.

args.name: id
args.description: The ID of the Product to return.

fields.name: productByHandle
fields.description: Return a product by its handle.

args.name: handle
args.description: A unique string that identifies the product. Handles are automatically generated based on the product's title, and are always lowercase. Whitespace and special characters are replaced with a hyphen: `-`. If there are multiple consecutive whitespace or special characters, then they're replaced with a single hyphen. Whitespace or special characters at the beginning are removed. If a duplicate product title is used, then the handle is auto-incremented by one. For example, if you had two products called `Potion`, then their handles would be `potion` and `potion-1`. After a product has been created, changing the product title doesn't update the handle.

fields.name: scriptTag
fields.description:
Theme app extensions

Your app might not pass App Store review if it uses script tags instead of theme app extensions. All new apps, and apps that integrate with Online Store 2.0 themes, should use theme app extensions, such as app blocks or app embed blocks. Script tags are an alternative you can use with only vintage themes. Learn more.

Lookup a script tag resource by ID.

args.name: id
args.description: The ID of the ScriptTag to return.

fields.name: scriptTags
fields.description:
Theme app extensions

Your app might not pass App Store review if it uses script tags instead of theme app extensions. All new apps, and apps that integrate with Online Store 2.0 themes, should use theme app extensions, such as app blocks or app embed blocks. Script tags are an alternative you can use with only vintage themes. Learn more.

A list of script tags.

args.name: query
args.description:
Supported filter parameters:
 - `app_id`
   - Acceptable Values:
     - `CURRENT`
     - `ALL`
     - `App ID number`
   - Default Value: `CURRENT`
 - `category`
   - Acceptable Values:
     - `SUBSCRIPTION`
     - `PRE_ORDER`
     - `TRY_BEFORE_YOU_BUY`
     - `OTHER`
 - `created_at`
 - `delivery_frequency`
 - `name`
 - `percentage_off`

See the detailed [search syntax](https://shopify.dev/api/usage/search-syntax)
for more information about using filters.

fields.name: shop
fields.description:
Returns the Shop resource corresponding to the access token used in the request. The Shop resource contains
business and store management settings for the shop.

fields.name: shopLocales
fields.description: A list of locales available on a shop.

args.name: published
args.description: Return only published locales.

fields.name: shopifyPaymentsAccount
fields.description: Shopify Payments account information, including balances and payouts.

fields.name: staffMember
fields.description: The StaffMember resource, by ID.

args.name: id
args.description: The ID of the staff member to return. If no ID is provided, then the staff member making the query (if any) is returned.

fields.name: standardMetafieldDefinitionTemplates
fields.description:
Standard metafield definitions are intended for specific, common use cases. Their namespace and keys reflect these use cases and are reserved.

Refer to all available [`Standard Metafield Definition Templates`](https://shopify.dev/api/admin-graphql/latest/objects/StandardMetafieldDefinitionTemplate).

fields.name: subscriptionBillingCycle
fields.description: Returns a subscription billing cycle found either by cycle index or date.

args.description: Input object used to select and use billing cycles.

fields.name: subscriptionBillingCycles
fields.description: Returns subscription billing cycles for a contract ID.

args.name: contractId
args.description: The ID of the subscription contract to retrieve billing cycles for.

args.name: billingCyclesDateRangeSelector
args.description: Select subscription billing cycles within a date range.

args.name: billingCyclesIndexRangeSelector
args.description: Select subscription billing cycles within an index range.

args.name: savedSearchId
args.description:
The ID of an existing saved search.
The search’s query string is used as the query argument.
Refer to [SavedSearch](https://shopify.dev/api/admin-graphql/latest/objects/savedsearch).
